etymology.description: 皂 (zào) is a variant form of 皁, which is in turn a variant form of 早 (zǎo, "early") retaining its original sense "acorn."
etymology.interpretation: 皂 (zào) originally represented the concept of "acorn" before it was adapted to signify colors such as black. This transformation shows the fluidity of meanings as characters evolved over time.

examples.chinese: 秋风吹过树林时(秋風吹過樹林時)，地上落满了皂和落叶(地上落滿了皂和落葉)。
examples.pinyin: qiū fēng chuīguò shùlín shí, dìshàng luò mǎn le zào hé luòyè.
examples.english: When the autumn wind blows through the forest, the ground is covered with acorns and fallen leaves.

examples.chinese: 山野中不时有皂掉落(山野中不時有皂掉落)，象征着秋天的丰收(象徵著秋天的豐收)。
examples.pinyin: shānyě zhōng bùshí yǒu zào diàoluò, xiàngzhēng zhe qiūtiān de fēngshōu.
examples.english: In the hills and fields, acorns occasionally fall, symbolizing the abundant harvest of autumn.
